page.title: 06LOVERSALL WATER PUMP
page.content: Loversall water pump is on the outskirts of Loversall, the pump is next to a stream by the main road. In the late Victorian stage the pump was used to provide drinking water for the village. The water came from the well at St.Catherines spring about a quarter of a mile away, a ram pump was used to pump water to a settling tank behind the wheel at Loversall. The slow flowing stream powered the wheel which then pumped the water up to the village. To power the wheel the stream has to be dammed and the water chanelled off to power the breast shot wheel. The wheel then drove a pump which raised the water level by 10 foot to the village above. Mr.Henderson started to renovate the pump in 1976 with the help of the council and now has it in working order.
